intro: Moraea tulbaghensis, commonly known as the Tulbagh lily, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea tulbaghensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
